books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality, told through the young eyes of Scout Finch in the Deep South.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: A dystopian social science fiction novel that presents a terrifying vision of a totalitarian regime in a perpetual state of war.

books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: The story of the mysteriously wealthy Jay Gatsby and his love for the beautiful Daisy Buchanan, set in the Jazz Age of Long Island.

books.title: The Catcher
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.description: A story about adolescent alienation and loss of innocence, as told by the disaffected Holden Caulfield.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: A classic novel that deals with issues of class, marriage, morality, and personal growth in 19th-century England.

books.title: The Hobbit
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: A fantasy adventure about the journey of Bilbo Baggins, who is swept into an epic quest to reclaim a lost Dwarf Kingdom.

books.title: Moby Dick
books.author: Herman Melville
books.description: An epic tale of the voyage of the whaling ship Pequod and its Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to kill the giant white whale, Moby Dick.

books.title: Eval Under Sun
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: The first volume in the epic fantasy series, where Frodo Baggins sets off on a journey to destroy the One Ring and defeat the dark lord Sauron.

books.title: War and Peace
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.description: A sweeping novel that interweaves the lives of several families during the Napoleonic Wars and explores themes of war, politics, and love.

books.title: Frankenstein
books.author: Mary Shelley
books.description: A Gothic novel that tells the story of Victor Frankenstein, a young scientist who creates a grotesque creature in an unorthodox experiment.
